Key Match Events: Pakistan overcame a top-order batting hiccup with sharp pace bowling to beat the Netherlands by 81 runs
Bas de Leede picked up 4-62 with his seam bowling to bowl out Pakistan for 286
Haris Rauf picked up 3-43, Shaheen Afridi claimed 1-37 and Hasan Ali bagging 2-37
Saud Shakeel and Mohammad Rizwan scripted Pakistan's revival with a 120-run partnership
Rauf then took the sting out of the Netherlands' chase, claiming the wickets of Teja Nidamanuru and Edwards in the space of three balls
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Scott Edwards thought Pakistan's total of 286 was a par total after he had won the toss and elected to chase on a dry wicket
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam said 'Credit to the bowlers, we started well and took wickets in the middle (overs)'
Vikramjit Singh made a fighting 52 off 67 balls and combined in a 70-run stand with de Leede
Babar Azam said 'We lost three wickets while batting, (but) the way Rizwan and Shakeel batted, they took it away.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands, which qualified for the World Cup with a dramatic Super Over win over the West Indies, showed little rustiness from their victory three months ago
Pakistan's revival was scripted by Saud Shakeel and Mohammad Rizwan, both playing in their first World Cup
Others: Pakistan's all-rounder Bas de Leede played a knock of 67 off 68 balls
Pakistan's express fast bowler Haris Rauf took 3-43
Pakistan's captain Babar Azam struggled for 18 balls in scoring 5 runs before pulling offspinner Colin Ackermann to short midwicket
